TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in LOC .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant claimed a sum of money before the ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG issued a payment order in summary proceedings . As the defendant filed an objection to the order , the court started dealing with the case in ordinary proceedings .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the action . On DATE it submitted the case to the court of appeal following the applicant 's appeal .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG found that ORG had violated the applicant 's right under LAW to a hearing within a reasonable time . The case was not complex and the applicant by his conduct had contributed to the length of the proceedings by not responding to a ORG request and by asking for adjournment of CARDINAL hearings . ORG also concluded that ORG had failed to proceed with the case in an efficient manner . It held that in view of the very simple legal question to be determined and the value of the claim , the court was obliged to organise its work in a way enabling it to decide the case within CARDINAL hearing .

CARDINAL . ORG refused to award the applicant just satisfaction in respect of non - pecuniary damage since the case had already been decided by the first - instance court and the applicant had contributed to the length of the proceedings . It ordered ORG to avoid any further delay in the proceedings ( should the case be returned to it ) and to reimburse the applicant 's legal costs .
CARDINAL . On DATE the court of appeal upheld the first - instance judgment .
